definition: to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
to worry/to concern oneself with/worried/anxiety/sorrow/(literary) to observe mourning

sentences.english: I always thought that was an optimistic person, there are not many worries.
sentences.chinese: 總以爲我是一個樂觀的人，不會有太多的煩憂。

sentences.english: The US would never gripe about a Chinese carrier off its shore.
sentences.chinese: 美國就不會爲中國航母來美國海岸感到煩憂。

sentences.english: One of them proposes going to Flower Island, a spot where all pain and sadness will disappear.
sentences.chinese: 其中一人提議要去可以排除一切煩憂的花之島。

sentences.english: To bear greater wrong, than hate's known injury.
sentences.chinese: 比憎恨的明傷是更大的煩憂。

sentences.english: With the New Year bell, forget all CARES and have a good happy every day.
sentences.chinese: 伴着新年鐘聲，忘記所有煩憂，開心快樂過好每一天。

definition: separated in life and death/to part for ever
the still of the night (idiom)/late at night
to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
to worry/to be on one's mind
